Method Detail

setQuery

public void setQuery(java.lang.String query)
Description copied from interface: Query
Set the query to be sent to the catalog. This will be a String containing a specification in a query language specific to the catalog being accessed. For example, the Internet Archive uses the Lucene query engine, so a query for this catalog would contain statements suitable for Lucene.

Specified by:
setQuery in interface Query
Parameters:
query - - the query to be sent to the catalog
See Also:
http://www.archive.org/advancedsearch.php

getQuery

public java.lang.String getQuery()
Description copied from interface: Query
Retrieve the query set using Query.setQuery(String).

Specified by:
getQuery in interface Query
Returns:
the query string

getNumResults

public int getNumResults()
Description copied from interface: Query
Return the number of results set for this query. Note that this is merely a request to the catalog, which may return fewer results per page.

Specified by:
getNumResults in interface Query
Returns:
the number of results set for this query

setNumResults

public void setNumResults(int numResults)
Description copied from interface: Query
Set the number of results that the catalog should return in a single page of results. Note that this is just a request and the catalog is free to return fewer results per page.

Specified by:
setNumResults in interface Query
Parameters:
numResults - the number of results requested per page.

setPageNo

Set the page number to be retrieved by the query.

page - the page number of the page to be retrieved by the query
